dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 5768 IH: Separation of Powers Act of 2014
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Poe of Texas (for himself and Mrs. Black) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To prohibit the use of funds for granting deferred action or other immigration relief to aliens not lawfully present in the United States.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Separation of Powers Act of 2014
.

subsection.text: None of the funds appropriated or otherwise made available to any Federal department or agency may be used to parole an alien into the United States or grant deferred action on a final order of removal, for any reason other than on a case-by-case basis for urgent humanitarian reasons.

subsection.header: For the issuance of work permits or green cards
subsection.text: None of the funds appropriated or otherwise made available to any Federal department or agency may be used to issue to any alien who, on the date of enactment of this Act, is unlawfully present in the United States any document attesting to the lawful permanent resident status of that alien, or to the authorization for employment in the United States of that alien.
